definitions.definition: separate or be separated into parts.
examples: consumer magazines can be divided into a number of different categories
synonyms: quarter; literarysunder "he divided his estate into separate holdings"diverge
bifurcate "the stairs divide at the mezzanine"classify
rank "living things are divided into three categories"

definitions.definition: separate (something) into portions and distribute a share to each of a number of people.
examples: Jack divided up the rest of the cash
synonyms: dispense; informaldivvy up "Jack divided up the cash"

definitions.definition: allocate (different parts of one's time, attention, or efforts) to different activities or places.
examples: the last years of her life were divided between Bermuda and Paris

definitions.definition: form a boundary between (two people or things).
examples: the artificial barrier that has divided an academic education from a vocational one
synonyms: split off "a curtain divided her cabin from the galley"

definitions.definition: (of a legislative assembly) separate or be separated into two groups for voting.

examples: the question had divided Frenchmen since the Revolution
synonyms: alienate; literarytear asunder "he aimed to divide his opponents"

definitions.definition: find how many times (a number) contains another.
(of a number) be susceptible to division without a remainder.
find how many times (a number) is contained in another.
(of a number) be contained in a number without a remainder.
